elements.name: require(bool,string)(authorisations[msg.sender].exists && uint256(authorisations[msg.sender].status) == uint256(Status.ACCEPTED),You do not have an accepted authorisation to access the door)

description:
SmartDoor.accessDoor() (contracts/contract.sol#82-95) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- require(bool,string)(authorisations[msg.sender].exists && uint256(authorisations[msg.sender].status) == uint256(Status.ACCEPTED),You do not have an accepted authorisation to access the door) (contracts/contract.sol#84)
markdown:
[SmartDoor.accessDoor()](contracts/contract.sol#L82-L95) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- [require(bool,string)(authorisations[msg.sender].exists && uint256(authorisations[msg.sender].status) == uint256(Status.ACCEPTED),You do not have an accepted authorisation to access the door)](contracts/contract.sol#L84)

description:
SmartDoor.reset() (contracts/contract.sol#195-213) has costly operations inside a loop:
	- delete accesses[guests[index]] (contracts/contract.sol#202)
markdown:

	- [delete accesses[guests[index]]](contracts/contract.sol#L202)
